body:
**Lost error context**

`start()` now logs errors as `{ err: String(err) }`, which drops stack traces and structured error fields (many callers in this codebase appear to log `{ err }`). This will make diagnosing the transient startup failures harder, which is the exact scenario this PR targets. Consider logging the original error object (or at least include `stack` when `err instanceof Error`).

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/cron/service/ops.ts
Line: 38:42

Comment:
**Lost error context**

`start()` now logs errors as `{ err: String(err) }`, which drops stack traces and structured error fields (many callers in this codebase appear to log `{ err }`). This will make diagnosing the transient startup failures harder, which is the exact scenario this PR targets. Consider logging the original error object (or at least include `stack` when `err instanceof Error`).

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
